patch 8.2.0487: Vim9: compiling not sufficiently tested

Problem:    Vim9: compiling not sufficiently tested.
Solution:   Add more tests.  Fix bug with PCALL.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/05afceeddc4afbbca60e4e6a729a50d33d4b19f7|patch 8.2.0488: Vim9: compiling can break when using a lambda inside …>
patch 8.2.0488: Vim9: compiling can break when using a lambda inside :def

Problem:    Vim9: Compiling can break when using a lambda inside :def.
Solution:   Do not keep a pointer to the dfunc_T for longer time.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.0488: Vim9: compiling can break when using a lambda inside … · vim/vim@05afcee
attachments.title: patch 8.2.0488: Vim9: compiling can break when using a lambda inside … · vim/vim@05afcee
attachments.text: …:def Problem: Vim9: Compiling can break when using a lambda inside :def. Solution: Do not keep a pointer to the dfunc_T for longer time.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/25b70c780a7e6063544e7f93c368fe403076f34e|patch 8.2.0489: Vim9: memory leaks>
patch 8.2.0489: Vim9: memory leaks

Problem:    Vim9: memory leaks.
Solution:   Free memory in the right place.  Add hints for using asan.
